The minimum required information to crea: The minimum required information to create a user. The password of the user will be generated by us and send to their e-mail.
The user's context determines at a high: The user's context determines at a high level their access to your storefront or manager. Where 'MGR' stands for the manager you're currently working in and 'WEB' for your storefront.
These self-managed roles can be used to: These self-managed roles can be used to manage the user's access and permissions to the system. You can manage these roles under 'roles and rights' at the 'manage' menu.
Teams are a way to group users together: Teams are a way to group users together and share data between them. Teams can also be used to manage the user's access to media sources.

This is your central hub for managing al: This is your central hub for managing all quotations. Here you can create new quotations, track their progress, and manage the entire quotation lifecycle from draft to completion.
This tab displays all your active quotat: This tab displays all your active quotations that are no longer in draft status. These are quotations that have been sent to clients or are in various stages of the sales process.
This section contains all your draft quo: This section contains all your draft quotations that are still being worked on. Use this area to continue editing quotations before sending them to clients. Drafts are kept separate to maintain a clean overview of your active quotations.
Here you'll find all deleted quotations. Don't worry - nothing is permanently lost! You can restore quotations from the bin or permanently delete them when you're sure you no longer need them.
Click this button to quickly create a ne: Click this button to quickly create a new quotation. You'll be taken to the quotation editor where you can add products, set pricing, and configure all quotation details.
Use this search bar to quickly find spec: Use this search bar to quickly find specific quotations by customer name, quotation number, or any other relevant information. The search works across all quotation data.
Switch between different view modes: Lis: Switch between different view modes: List view for a compact overview, Grid view for a balanced display of quotations and items, or Items-only view to focus on individual quotation items.
Control how many quotations are displaye: Control how many quotations are displayed per page and navigate through multiple pages. You can adjust the number of items shown to match your workflow preferences.
This table provides a comprehensive over: This table provides a comprehensive overview of your quotations. You can sort by different columns, view quotation status, customer information, and quickly access individual quotations for editing or review.
Access quotation-specific settings here. Configure default quotation templates, pricing rules, approval workflows, and other quotation-related preferences to streamline your quotation process.
Search for a standardized term from the: Search for a standardized term from the Prindustry Ecosystem, so it is linked and recognized for use in the Prindustry Marketplace
Create a new box by searching through st: Create a new box by searching through standardized products and materials. This will search the global database for matching items and create a new box configuration based on standardization data.
Add an existing box from your previously: Add an existing box from your previously created boxes. This allows you to reuse box configurations that you have already set up, saving time by not having to recreate common box types.
Create a new option by searching through: Create a new option by searching through standardized materials and finishes. This searches the global database to find matching option configurations and creates a new option for this box based on industry standards.
Add an existing option from your previou: Add an existing option from your previously created options library. This lets you reuse option configurations like materials, finishes, or specifications that you have already defined for other boxes.
Select how you'd like to create your pro: Select how you'd like to create your product assortment
Start with pre-configured products from: Start with pre-configured products from our standard catalog with optimized boxes, options, and pricing.
Import product configurations from an ex: Import product configurations from an external producer or supplier with their specifications.
Build everything from scratch with compl: Build everything from scratch with complete control over boxes, options, dividers, and pricing.
Select an option above to see what happe: Select an option above to see what happens next in your product creation journey.
You'll continue with the current flow, u: You'll continue with the current flow, using category-based product templates. This includes pre-configured boxes, options, and pricing models that have been tested and proven effective.
You'll start with a completely blank can: You'll start with a completely blank canvas where you can build your product structure from the ground up. This gives you full control over every aspect including boxes, options, excludes, and pricing strategies.
You'll be able to import existing produc: You'll be able to import existing product configurations from external producers or suppliers, maintaining their specifications while adapting them to your business needs.
enable to group boxes for separate calcu: enable to group boxes for separate calculations
Configure which options cannot be select: Configure which options cannot be selected together for this product category
Review your product configuration before: Review your product configuration before generating all variants
All combinations will be calculated indi: All combinations will be calculated individually
individual product variants in your cata: individual product variants in your catalog. Each variant will be available for ordering and pricing.
This name is used internally as a unique: This name is used internally as a unique identifier for the product. It links the product to the Prindustry database and should be unique within your organization. Choose a name that clearly distinguishes this product from others.
The name shown to users and customers: The name shown to users and customers
This category has an unfinished wizard -: This category has an unfinished wizard - click to continue
Start by selecting the type of product y: Start by selecting the type of product you want to create. This will determine the available options in the following steps.
Search and select a category that best m: Search and select a category that best matches your product. This helps organize your products and apply relevant settings.
Choose the producer who will manufacture: Choose the producer who will manufacture this product. You can select from existing producers or add a new one.
Select the specific category within the: Select the specific category within the producer's catalog that matches your product.
Configure the boxes and options that def: Configure the boxes and options that define your product's variations. Each box represents a product attribute (like size, color, etc.).
Set up option combinations that should n: Set up option combinations that should not be available together. This prevents invalid product configurations.
Review your product configuration and fi: Review your product configuration and finalize all settings before saving.
Choose a descriptive product name to hel: Choose a descriptive product name to help identify it later.
Consider the target audience when select: Consider the target audience when selecting the product type.
Use specific keywords to narrow down cat: Use specific keywords to narrow down category search results.
Check multiple categories if your produc: Check multiple categories if your product fits in more than one.
The name is a unique, internal identifie: The name is a unique, internal identifier used for system integration and standardization across the Prindustry platform. It ensures consistent referencing of entities (like boxes or options) in APIs, automation, and data exchange between services. The display name, on the other hand, is what users see in the interface and should always be localized for each supported language. For user-facing text, always use the display name.
Review producer ratings and reviews befo: Review producer ratings and reviews before making a selection.
Consider producers with experience in si: Consider producers with experience in similar products.
Ensure the selected category matches all: Ensure the selected category matches all key attributes of your product.
Consult with the producer if unsure abou: Consult with the producer if unsure about category selection.
Define clear and distinct options for ea: Define clear and distinct options for each box to avoid confusion.
Use images or descriptions to illustrate: Use images or descriptions to illustrate option differences.
Think through all possible option combin: Think through all possible option combinations to identify conflicts.
Regularly update excludes as new options: Regularly update excludes as new options are added.
Double-check all settings before finaliz: Double-check all settings before finalizing the product.
Preview the product as it will appear to: Preview the product as it will appear to customers.
Print products require calculation refer: Print products require calculation references (calc_ref) for proper pricing. The name is a unique internal identifier, while the display name is what users see (and should be localized). Make sure all boxes have complete material, format, and printing color information, and always use display names for user-facing text.
Custom products allow for flexible prici: Custom products allow for flexible pricing and don't require full calculation references.
Each option can have its own price. This: Each option can have its own price. This method is simpler but requires manual price entry for all options.
Prices are calculated based on material: Prices are calculated based on material costs, machine tick prices, and other factors. Requires complete calc_ref data.
Save your progress frequently to avoid l: Save your progress frequently to avoid losing changes
You can navigate back to previous steps: You can navigate back to previous steps to make changes
Completed steps are marked with a green: Completed steps are marked with a green checkmark
Use the help panel for step-specific gui: Use the help panel for step-specific guidance
Select a category from the producer's ca: Select a category from the producer's catalog
Search for a category from our preset li: Search for a category from our preset library
Create a custom category or search exist: Create a custom category or search existing ones
Configure category details including nam: Configure category details including name, description, and visibility
Assign calculation references to boxes a: Assign calculation references to boxes and options to enable proper price calculations
Calculation references link boxes and op: Calculation references link boxes and options to specific pricing calculations. For example, assign 'format' to a size box, or 'material' to a paper type option.
Calculation reference is required for fu: Calculation reference is required for full calculation products
This box has no options. Add options in: This box has no options. Add options in the 'Edit Boxes & Options' step to configure calculation references for them.
Please configure boxes and options in th: Please configure boxes and options in the previous step
Configure pricing calculation methods fo: Configure pricing calculation methods for your product
if this categories price calculation nee: if this categories price calculation needs additional startcosts, you can add them here.
Configure the boxes and options that def: Configure the boxes and options that define your product's variations
Define profit margins and markup for you: Define profit margins and markup for your product
Configure tiered pricing tables for your: Configure tiered pricing tables for your product
Allow customers to enter custom quantiti: Allow customers to enter custom quantities
Prices are automatically calculated base: Prices are automatically calculated based on:
Machine tick prices and setup costs: Machine tick prices and setup costs
Complete calc_ref data for all options: Complete calc_ref data for all options
Best for: Complex print products with va: Best for: Complex print products with variable material and production costs
Manual price entry for each option with: Manual price entry for each option with optional base calculations:
Set fixed prices for each product option: Set fixed prices for each product option
Optionally use base calculations as star: Optionally use base calculations as starting point
Full control over final pricing structur: Full control over final pricing structure
Best for: Standard products, custom item: Best for: Standard products, custom items, or when you want direct control over pricing
Start by selecting the type of product y: Start by selecting the type of product you want to create. Choose between Prindustry Preset, Producer, or Blank Category.
Configure category details including nam: Configure category details including name, description, visibility, and calculation settings.
Set up pricing calculation methods, star: Set up pricing calculation methods, starting costs, and production schedules for your product.
Configure tiered pricing tables with qua: Configure tiered pricing tables with quantity ranges and incremental steps for your product.
Define profit margins and markup percent: Define profit margins and markup percentages to ensure proper pricing strategy.
Assign calculation references to boxes a: Assign calculation references to boxes and their options. This links your product variations to the pricing calculation system.
Prindustry Preset: Start with a pre-conf: Prindustry Preset: Start with a pre-configured category template.
Producer: Import a category directly fro: Producer: Import a category directly from a producer's catalog.
Blank Category: Build a completely custo: Blank Category: Build a completely custom category from scratch.
Set visibility to control where your cat: Set visibility to control where your category appears (finder, webshops, all).
Configure display names for all supporte: Configure display names for all supported languages.
Choose the appropriate calculation metho: Choose the appropriate calculation method for pricing.
Ensure all boxes have complete material,: Ensure all boxes have complete material, format, and printing color information.
Verify that all required fields have bee: Verify that all required fields have been completed.
Set starting costs to establish a baseli: Set starting costs to establish a baseline for pricing calculations.
Choose between semi-calculation and full: Choose between semi-calculation and full-calculation methods.
Configure production schedules to set re: Configure production schedules to set realistic delivery timeframes.
Define quantity ranges with appropriate: Define quantity ranges with appropriate incremental steps.
Pricing tables are optional but help pro: Pricing tables are optional but help provide clear pricing structure.
Consider your target market when setting: Consider your target market when setting quantity tiers.
Set appropriate profit margins based on: Set appropriate profit margins based on your business model.
Consider market competition when definin: Consider market competition when defining markup percentages.
Review margins regularly to ensure profi: Review margins regularly to ensure profitability.
Assign calc_ref to boxes to identify wha: Assign calc_ref to boxes to identify what aspect they control (format, material, etc.).
For full calculation products, all boxes: For full calculation products, all boxes must have a calculation reference assigned.
Options can have additional references f: Options can have additional references for binding type, direction, or main references.
Use consistent references across similar: Use consistent references across similar product categories.
Start with a pre-configured category fro: Start with a pre-configured category from Prindustry's catalog. Includes complete setup with boxes, options, and calculation references. Perfect for standard print products.
Import a category directly from a produc: Import a category directly from a producer's catalog. Uses the producer's pricing and configuration. Ideal for reselling or white-label products.
Build a completely custom category from: Build a completely custom category from scratch. Full control over all settings, boxes, and pricing. Best for unique or specialized products.
The system uses two types of identifiers: The system uses two types of identifiers:
A unique identifier used for system inte: A unique identifier used for system integration, APIs, and data exchange. Never shown to end users.
The text shown to users in the interface: The text shown to users in the interface. Should always be localized for each supported language.
Configure the basic information for your: Configure the basic information for your category:
Set the name, description, and visibilit: Set the name, description, and visibility settings for your category.
Provide localized names for each languag: Provide localized names for each language your platform supports. This ensures customers see the category in their preferred language.
Control where your category appears: Pro: Control where your category appears: Product Finder only, Webshops only, or everywhere.
Each box represents a product attribute: Each box represents a product attribute that customers can choose:
Format: Size dimensions (A4, A5, custom: Format: Size dimensions (A4, A5, custom sizes)
Printing Colors: CMYK, Pantone, spot col: Printing Colors: CMYK, Pantone, spot colors
Pricing tables define quantity-based pri: Pricing tables define quantity-based pricing tiers for your product. They help customers understand bulk discounts and pricing structure.
Pricing tables are optional. You can ski: Pricing tables are optional. You can skip this step if you don't need tiered pricing or if prices will be calculated dynamically.
Margins ensure profitability by adding a: Margins ensure profitability by adding a percentage markup to your base costs. Consider:
Volume expectations and economies of sca: Volume expectations and economies of scale
Calculation references link your product: Calculation references link your product configuration to the pricing engine. They tell the system how to interpret each box and option.
Each box should have a calc_ref that des: Each box should have a calc_ref that describes what it controls:
Options can have additional references f: Options can have additional references for specific attributes:
Main reference - Core attributes like fo: Main reference - Core attributes like format, material, weight
Binding type - Specific binding methods: Binding type - Specific binding methods (saddle stitch, perfect bound, etc.)
Binding direction - Left or top binding: Binding direction - Left or top binding orientation
For full calculation products: All boxe: For full calculation products: All boxes must have a calculation reference assigned.
